image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The housemates of missing Queensland teenager Pheobe Bishop have been charged with her murder.

title.children: Pheobe Bishop's housemates charged with murder

image.altText: Musk with Trump

props.synopsis: The US president accused the Tesla boss of criticising his sweeping tax and spending legislation as it proposes cutting consumer tax credits for electric vehicles.

title.children: Trump 'disappointed' in Musk as feud over 'big, beautiful bill' escalates

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie speaks to the camera

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff says he plans to call a state election as early as next Tuesday, after losing a no-confidence motion by a single vote.

title.children: Jeremy Rockliff aiming to call Tasmanian election on Tuesday

image.altText: Alan Stockdale stands in front of Liberal branding

props.synopsis: This week in politics the parliament has achieved gender parity despite tone-deaf commentary, an independent triumphed after a recount and Dorinda Cox changed her tune.

title.children: Liberal men still struggle to read the room when it comes to women

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Accused triple-murderer Erin Patterson has denied telling guests at her fatal lunch that she had cancer, despite evidence to the contrary given earlier in the trial by the sole surviving guest.

title.children: Erin Patterson denies telling lunch guests she had cancer in murder trial

image.altText: Aiden O'Neill of the Socceroos and Daichi Kamada of Japan chase after the ball

props.synopsis: The Socceroos are on the brink of qualifying for the 2026 FIFA World Cup after Aziz Behich's stoppage-time winner sinks Japan 1-0.

title.children: Socceroos all-but qualify for World Cup with smash-and-grab win in Perth

image.altText: Trump and Xi shake hands with the American and Chinese flags in the background

props.synopsis: The US president posted on Truth Social that a phone call with his Chinese counterpart lasted an hour and a half and "focused almost entirely on trade".

title.children: Trump and Xi hold phone call 'focused almost entirely on trade'

image.altText: Donald Trump in a black suit and blue tie gesturing with his hands sideways while speaking on a White House balcony

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has signed a new proclamation to implement a ban on people from 12 countries travelling into the United States, in a bid to "protect the national security" of the nation.

title.children: Trump announces new travel ban on visitors from 12 nations

props.synopsis: The BBC says its team of journalists and crew were "tied up, blindfolded, strip searched, interrogated and threatened."

title.children: BBC journalists held at gunpoint and strip searched by IDF, broadcaster claims

image.altText: Woman stands with weight loss drug injection in her hands.

props.synopsis: The warning comes after the agency received 40 reports relating to unintended pregnancies while using such weight loss drugs.

title.children: Pregnancy warning to women taking 'skinny jabs' like Ozempic and Mounjaro

image.altText: Knights coach Adam O’Brien looks prior to a match, looking at the field

props.synopsis: Newcastle coach Adam O'Brien has described the booing by Knights fans at his team, before a comeback win sealed in golden point, as "disappointing" and "hurtful".

title.children: Knights fans who booed their team 'don't know anything about rugby league'

image.altText: GettyImages-2218028431

props.synopsis: Hawthorn have bounced back from three consecutive losses to claim a comprehensive win over the Western Bulldogs.

title.children: 'Showboating a bit': Hawk backs teammate's antics as they claim important win

image.altText: A pianist performs on stage, with a large screen displaying his late wife on a waterfront in the background.

props.synopsis: In 1971, Vincenzo Pandolfi's life changed when a chance meeting introduced him to "the light of his life", Elaine. Even in the face of illness and heartbreak, the enduring power of their love continues.

title.children: 'She was the light of my life': How a chance meeting sparked a 50-year love story

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin stands in front of two iranian flags and a russian flag

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin has told US President Donald Trump that he is ready to use Russia's close partnership with Iran to help with negotiations over Iran's nuclear programme.

title.children: Putin ready to help Trump on Iran nuclear negotiations

image.altText: A side by side image of Trump in a suit raising a thumb and Biden in a suit.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says the alleged conspiracy — a cover-up of Joe Biden's cognitive decline — marks "one of the most dangerous and concerning scandals in American history".

title.children: Trump orders probe into Joe Biden's alleged use of 'autopen'

image.altText: Australia's Bec Rawlings was crowned the 'Queen of Bare Knuckle' after her win in two rounds over Alma Garcia.

props.synopsis: The WA Combat Sports Commission declines an application for professional bare-knuckle boxing fights.

title.children: Australian-first bare-knuckle fighting event denied for Perth

image.altText: A man and a woman hugging

props.synopsis: The Israeli prime minister revealed the bodies of Judy Weinstein-Hagi and Gadi Hagi have been retrieved from Gaza by Israeli forces.

title.children: Israeli PM Netanyahu says bodies of two hostages retrieved from Gaza

image.altText: Two security guards walk past a line of motorbikes outside Bali's Kerobokan prison.

props.synopsis: An Australian man has been arrested in Bali on suspicion of drug possession, Indonesian authorities say.

title.children: Australian man arrested for drug possession in Bali

image.altText: An exterior shot of an ANU building.

props.synopsis: As the Australian National University grapples with its dire financial position, the first of several rounds of job cuts has been announced as the institution seeks to save $250 million by the end of the year, including $100 million from salaries.

title.children: 'Tip of the iceberg': First round of job cuts announced by ANU

image.altText: A sign against a desert landscape.

props.synopsis: An iron ore company wants to explore for minerals at the WA site of one of Australia's worst industrial disasters.

title.children: Miner bids to explore one of Australia's most poisonous landscapes

image.altText: A drone shot of Thredbo Resort

props.synopsis: Snow is expected to fall in NSW for the official start of ski season this weekend, despite fears warmer forecasts could spoil conditions over winter.

title.children: Snowy start to NSW ski season as traders 'nervous' about warm winter

image.altText: Sarah Hanson-Young press conference

props.synopsis: The Greens senator says her former colleague's decision to party hop is unfair on voters, and has accused the prime minister of hypocrisy for welcoming her.

title.children: Hanson-Young says 'honourable' move is for Cox to quit after defection

image.altText: Morten Harket posing for a photo in front of a bush

props.synopsis: A-ha lead singer Morten Harket shared the news of the diagnosis on the band's website, revealing he's already undergone several rounds of brain surgery.

title.children: A-ha frontman Morten Harket diagnosed with Parkinson's disease

image.altText: Donald Trump points.

props.synopsis: A rift is brewing within the US Republican Party as President Donald Trump attempts to muscle his Big, Beautiful Bill through Congress.

title.children: Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill' is dividing Republicans. Here's what it contains

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: The anger with Donald Trump's "big, beautiful bill" is taking many creative forms of Elon Musk's X account. It's a different story on Trump's Truth Social.

title.children: Musk vs Republicans leaves Trump to wonder if he's created a monster

image.altText: An artist impression of Moore Point plan

props.synopsis: Half an hour south-west of Sydney's Rosehill Gardens Racecourse lies a stretch of industrial land ripe for rezoning, Liverpool City Council argues.

title.children: Is this 'once-in-a-generation' mini city the Rosehill Racecourse solution?

image.altText: A man in his late 20s with dark brown hair, smiling, sitting in farming equipment

props.synopsis: When former Canberra Raiders player and farmer Luke Bateman joined TikTok, he went viral for his love of fantasy novels. A month later he announced a book deal, but the news has generated controversy.

title.children: Luke Bateman went viral and got a book deal. Then the tide turned

image.altText: A court sketch of a man with his face blurred.

props.synopsis: The Newcastle man has been sentenced after a trial that involved two siblings, including a daughter who gave evidence as different personalities.

title.children: 21 years' jail for father whose abuse led to daughter's multiple personalities

image.altText: A birdseye view of a house submerged under flood water.

props.synopsis: An independent flood study flagging high-risk areas in Victoria's south-west is abandoned after councillors decide they do not trust the data.

title.children: Council cans peer-reviewed flood study, citing 'supposed science'

image.altText: A photo of a crushed white powder in a small clear bag next to a measuring ruler.

props.synopsis: A public health alert is issued after a dangerous drug cocktail is found circulating in Canberra for the first time, sold as a counterfeit prescription anxiety medication.

title.children: Drug cocktail 'not previously found' detected in Canberra

image.altText: A graphic featuring three small toys in a cardboard box.

props.synopsis: The blind-box market is worth billions of dollars per year, and the most successful players in this industry thrive on loyal fans, social media and some clever marketing tactics.

title.children: Why is Gen Z obsessed with blind boxes?

image.altText: aerial shots of Paradise Dam

props.synopsis: Farmers in Queensland's Bundaberg region are cautiously optimistic after the government ordered Sunwater to start early works rebuilding a beleaguered water source.

title.children: Sunwater directed to start work on $4.4 billion Paradise Dam rebuild

image.altText: Close-up of Tasmania Devils AFL team foundation jumper design.

props.synopsis: As political turmoil continues to engulf Tasmania, the Devils AFL team remains at high risk of becoming collateral damage.

title.children: What will happen to Tasmania's AFL team? Depends on who you ask

image.altText: Image of man with serious face and black shirt

props.synopsis: A man who "savagely" attacked and stabbed former Bachelorette contestant Paddy Colliar, who was working as a topless waiter at a 60th birthday party, has been jailed for at least four years.

title.children: Man jailed for four years over stabbing of 'good Samaritan' former reality TV contestant

image.altText: Yossra Aboulfadl in pharmacist coat holding medicine looking away

props.synopsis: One of the letters to Prime Minister Anthony Albanese calls on the government to apply "sustained diplomatic pressure to lift the blockade" on Gaza for medical supplies, food and water.

title.children: 'Time for action': Australian healthcare workers sign open letters on Gaza
